Term.Definition: This ratio uses half of the vertical and one-fourth the horizontal color resolutions, with only one-eighth of the bandwidth of the maximum color resolutions used.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Definition: In 4:1:1 chroma subsampling, the horizontal color resolution is quartered, and the bandwidth is halved compared to no chroma subsampling.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Definition: In 4:2:0, the horizontal sampling is doubled compared to 4:1:1, but as the Cb and Cr channels are only sampled on each alternate line in this scheme, the vertical resolution is halved.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Definition: The two chroma components are sampled at half the sample rate of luma: the horizontal chroma resolution is halved.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML
First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: 4:4:4 Y'CbCr
Term.Definition: Each of the three Y'CbCr components have the same sample rate.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: 4:4:4 R'G'B'
Term.Definition: Note that "4:4:4" may instead be referring to R'G'B' color space, which implicitly does not have any chroma subsampling at all.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML
